instructions:
FOR THE HOLES & TOPPING:
3 1/4 tbsp butter, frozen and cut in 50 pieces
1/2 cup brown sugar, packed
1 tsp cinnamon

Prepare mashed potatoes. Dissolve yeast in warm water, add pinch of sugar and let stand until bubbles
form. In a large bowl cream margarine, shortening, granulated sugar and salt. Add scalded milk, mashed
potatoes and whisk until well blended. With a wooden spoon stir in a cup of flour. Then mix in the beaten
egg and yeast mixture. Gradually mix in flour until the dough begins to pull away from the side of the
bowl. At this point it is probably easier to mix in just enough flour by hand until this very soft dough is
smooth and can be held in your hand and transferred to a greased bowl for rising. Turn the dough until it is
greased all over. Cover with a damp cloth and let rise in an 85 F oven until it has doubled in size *(about 1 1/4
hours)*.
Punch down and knead on a lightly floured board for 5 minutes. Then divide in two and spread evenly in
two buttered 8x8 inch pans. Again, cover and let rise until it doubles *(about 1 1/4 hours)*. Make 25 holes
with your finger in each pan and press small pieces of butter into the holes in the dough. Combine brown
sugar and cinnamon and fill the holes using about 3/4 of the brown sugar mixture and sprinkle the remaining
sugar over the dough. Bake in a preheated 365 F oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until it is golden brown and
crusty on top.
name: Moravian Sugar Cake
creator: Jim Decker
